    Breakpoints

    variables

    breakpoints

    $breakpoints: (
    xs: 0,
    phone: 450px,
    tablet: 768px,
    desktop: 960px
);
    View source

    Map structure

    key Namekey Descriptionkey Typekey Value
    xs

    XS

    		Size0
    phone

    Phone

    		Size450px
    tablet

    Tablet

    		Size768px
    desktop

    Desktop

    		Size960px

    Used by

    • [function] breakpoint-var

    Colours

    variables

    body-bg

    $body-bg: #ffffff;
    View source

    Map structure

    key Namekey Descriptionkey Typekey Value
    body-bg

    Colour of the body

    		Color#efefef

    red

    $red: #c70505;
    View source

    Map structure

    key Namekey Descriptionkey Typekey Value
    red

    Our default shade of red

    		Color#c70505

    colors-blue

    $colors-blue: #0a3473;
    View source

    Map structure

    key Namekey Descriptionkey Typekey Value
    blue

    Blue

    		Color#0a3473
    blueDark

    Dark blue

    		Color#00183c
    blueExtraLight

    Extra light blue

    		Color#6ce9ff
    blueLight

    Light blue

    		Color#21c9e6

    General

    mixins

    square

    @mixin square($size: 50px, $bgcolor: $colors-blue, $bordercolor: #000000, $bordersize: 2px) { ... }
    View source

    Description

    A mixin to create a square that can then be extended

    Parameters

    parameter Nameparameter Descriptionparameter Typeparameter Default value
    $size

    The width and height of the square

    		Size50px
    $bgcolor

    The background colour of the square

    		Colour$colors-blue
    $bordercolor

    The border colour of the square

    		Colour#000000
    $bordersize

    The size of the border of the square

    		Size2px

    Content

    This mixin allows extra content to be passed (through the @content directive). Role: [whatever you would like to style the square]

    Example

    square .foo

    .foo {
  @include square() {
       color: white;
  }
}

    placeholder

    @mixin placeholder() { ... }
    View source

    Description

    Helper mixin to style placeholder content cross-browser

    Parameters

    None.

    Content

    This mixin allows extra content to be passed (through the @content directive). Role: [whatever you would like to style the placeholder]

    Example

    placeholder .foo

    .foo {
  @include placeholder() {
       color: white;
  }
}

    functions

    breakpoint-var

    @function breakpoint-var($grid-breakpoints, $breakpoint) { ... }
    View source

    Description

    Return the value in pixels of the breakpoint key provided

    Parameters

    parameter Nameparameter Descriptionparameter Typeparameter Default value
    $grid-breakpoints

    The variable object used to find the right size

    		Var— none
    $breakpoint

    The key to reference the variable object for

    		String— none

    Example

    placeholder .foo

    .foo {
  width: breakpoint-var(phone);
}

    Requires

    • [variable] breakpoints

    add

    @function add($a, $b) { ... }
    View source

    Description

    Return the value in pixels of the breakpoint key provided

    Parameters

    parameter Nameparameter Descriptionparameter Typeparameter Default value
    $a

    The first value to be added

    		Size— none
    $b

    The second value to be added

    		Size— none

    Example

    placeholder .foo

    .foo {
  width: add(10px, 25px);
}
